com.camerontec.util.time

Class WallClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.time.WallClock

  • public final class WallClock
extends Object
    Class providing absolute nanosecond precision time if available, or absolute millisecond precision (scaled to nanoseconds) time if not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WallClock

        public WallClock()

    • Method Detail

      • haveNativeTime

        public static boolean haveNativeTime()
        Return whether the system supports timestamps from a native library.

        A return value of true implies that sub-millisecond timestamps may be available Whether they are or not depends on the capabilities of the underlying platform.

        A return value of false guarantees that sub-millisecond precision timestamps are not available.

        Returns:
        True if the system supports timestamps from a native library, false otherwise.

      • nanoTime

        public static long nanoTime()
        Return the absolute system time in nanoseconds.

        This method always returns the system time regardless of platform capabilities, but the actual precision of the returned timestamp will be at best the resolution of the underlying platform clock and then only if there is native time support for that platform.

        Whether there is native time support for this platform may be tested via haveNativeTime.

        Returns:
        The absolute system time in nanoseconds at the precision of the underlying platform clock (if the native clock is available) or at millisecond precision otherwise. When a milliseconds based timestamp is returned it is scaled up to the equivalent nanoseconds value.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Run a standalone program which loads the native time lib and then calls nanoTime().
        Parameters:
        args - Ignored.
